title: 113_s3014
content: The Act titled "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Care Improvement Act of 2014" extends and modifies a pilot program on assisted living services for veterans with traumatic brain injury. The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008 is amended to require quarterly reports on a pilot program for assisted living services for veterans with traumatic brain injury. The report must include the number of participants and completions in the pilot program, satisfaction levels of participants and their families, interim findings on program success, and recommendations for improvement. The final report is due within 60 days after the pilot program's completion. The final report on the pilot program must be submitted to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, including a description of the program, assessment of activities, and evaluation for enhancing rehabilitation and community reintegration of veterans with traumatic brain injury. The pilot program under review by the Secretary evaluates its effectiveness in providing unique services compared to existing independent living programs under title 38, United States Code. The report will assess if the pilot program duplicates services, how it differs from existing programs, suggestions for improvement, and the possibility of incorporating it into current programs. The pilot program under review by the Secretary evaluates its effectiveness in providing unique services compared to existing independent living programs under title 38, United States Code. Recommendations for improving the pilot program, including incorporating it into current programs, are to be considered. Amendments are made to define Community-Based Brain Injury Residential Rehabilitative Care Services. Amendments are made to define Community-Based Brain Injury Residential Rehabilitative Care Services, including rehabilitation and personal care. The effective date of these amendments is the enactment of the Act, with no new appropriations authorized for implementation.
